entry.title: Less Favoured Area Compensatory Allowances Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations implement Commission Regulation 1750/1999 (O.J. L214, 13.8.99, p. 31) (“the Commission Regulation”) laying down detailed rules for the application of Council Regulation 1257/1999 (O.J. L160, 26.6.1999, p. 80) (“the Council Regulation”) on support for rural development from the European Agricultural Guidance and Guarantee Fund (EAGGF) and amending and repealing certain Regulations. They also implement Measure 2 of the Northern Ireland Rural Development Programme approved by the Commission (Commission Decision No. C(2000) 3638)) under Article 44 of the Council Regulation.

entry.title: The Export Restrictions (Foot-And-Mouth Disease) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations implement restrictions on exports of certain animals and animal products in accordance with Commission Decision of 21st February 2001 concerning certain protection measures with regard to foot-and-mouth disease in the United Kingdom (not yet published in the Official Journal).

entry.title: The Civil Aviation (Chargeable Air Services) (Detention and Sale of Aircraft for Eurocontrol) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations provide for the detention and sale of aircraft on behalf of Eurocontrol where default is made in the payment to Eurocontrol of charges for air services specified by the Civil Aviation Authority (“the CAA”) by virtue of section 73 of the Transport Act 2000.

entry.title: The Civil Aviation (Chargeable Air Services) (Detention and Sale of Aircraft) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations provide for the detention and sale of aircraft where default is made in the payment of charges for air services specified by the Civil Aviation Authority (“the CAA”) by virtue of section 73 of the Transport Act 2000 other than charges payable to Eurocontrol.

entry.title: The Private Streets (Construction) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: These regulations amend the Private Streets (Construction) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1994 (“the principal regulations”).

entry.title: Private Streets (Amendment) (1992 Order) (Commencement) Order (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation on 20th February 2001 the provisions of Article 3 of the Private Streets (Amendment) (Northern Ireland) Order 1992 which provides for:—

entry.title: The South Gloucestershire Primary Care Trust (Establishment) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order establishes the South Gloucestershire Primary Care Trust (“the trust”), as provided for under section 16A of the National Health Service Act 1977. It specifies the area for which the trust is established (article 3 and the Schedule) and makes provision for the membership of the trust (article 4). It specifies the trust’s operational date (article 5); limitations on the exercise of its functions during its preparatory period (article 6) and makes provision for assistance to the trust during its preparatory period (article 7).

entry.title: The Justices' Chief Executives (Accounts) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations lay down the payment, accounting and banking requirements for justices' chief executives to take account of the changes in the financial arrangements for magistrates' courts made by section 91 of the Access to Justice Act 1999 which comes into force on 1st April 2001.

entry.title: The Social Security (Contributions) (Re-rating and National Insurance Funds Payments) Order 2001

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Social Security (Contributions) (Re-rating and National Insurance Funds Payments) Order 2001

entry.summary: This Order reduces the rate of secondary Class 1 contributions, specified in section 9(2) of the Social Security Contributions and Benefits Act 1992 (“the Act”), from 12.2 per cent. to 11.9 per cent. It increases from £3,825 to £3,955 the amount of earnings below which an earner may be excepted from liability for Class 2 contributions, specified in section 11(4) of the Act. It also amends the amount of a Class 3 contribution specified in section 13(1) of the Act from £6.55 to £6.75 (Articles 2 to 4).

entry.title: The Parent Governor Representatives (England) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for representatives of parent governors at maintained schools to be included in overview and scrutiny committees of local education authorities in England. They also provide for the election of parent governor representatives to be included in the education committees of authorities in the Isles of Scilly and the City of London.

entry.title: The Hill Farm Allowance Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations, which apply to England, implement Commission Regulation 1750/1999 (O.J. L214, 13.8.99, p. 31) (“the Commission Regulation”) laying down detailed rules for the application of Council Regulation 1257/1999 (O.J. L160, 26.6.1999, p. 80) (“the rural development Regulation”) on support for rural development from the European Agricultural Guidance and Guarantee Fund (EAGGF) and amending and repealing certain Regulations. They also implement Chapter 9 of the England Rural Development Programme approved by the Commission (Commission Decision No. C(2000) 3003) under Article 44 of the Council Regulation.

entry.title: The Social Security (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Income Support (General) Regulations 1987 (S.I. 1987/1967), the Jobseeker’s Allowance Regulations 1996 (S.I. 1996/207), the Social Security (Claims and Payments) Regulations 1987 (S.I. 1987/1968) and the Social Security (Back to Work Bonus) (No. 2) Regulations 1996 (S.I. 1996/2570).

entry.title: The Housing Benefit (General) Amendment Regulations 2001 (revoked)
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Housing Benefit (General) Regulations 1987 (S.I. 1987/1971) in the following respects.

entry.title: The Non-Domestic Rate (Scotland) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order prescribes a rate of 47.0 pence in the pound as the non-domestic rate to be levied throughout Scotland in respect of financial year 2001-02.

entry.title: Welfare of Animals (Slaughter or Killing) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Welfare of Animals (Slaughter or Killing) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996 (“the 1996 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Learning and Skills Act 2000 (Commencement No. 3 and Savings and Transitional Provisions) Order 2001

ukm:Subject.Value: EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This order brings provisions of the Learning and Skills Act 2000 into force on the various dates specified in the schedule to the Order. In particular, in England, the dissolution of the Further Education Funding Council for England (FEFC) is brought into effect on 1st April 2001 and the Learning and Skills Council, from that date, takes up its main duties in connection with the education and training of persons aged 16 to 19, the education and training of persons over 19 and the encouragement of all individuals and employers in those fields.

entry.title: Royal Ulster Constabulary Reserve (Full–time) (Appointment and Conditions of Service) (Amendment) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Royal Ulster Constabulary Reserve (Full-time) (Appointment and Conditions of Service) Regulations 1996.

entry.title: The Portsmouth City Primary Care Trust (Establishment) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order establishes the Portsmouth City Primary Care Trust (“the trust”), as provided for under section 16A of the National Health Service Act 1977. It specifies the area for which the trust is established (article 3 and the Schedule), its operational date (article 5) and limitations on the exercise of its functions during its preparatory period (article 6). It makes provision for the membership of the trust (article 4) and for assistance to the trust during its preparatory period (article 7).

entry.title: The County Courts (Financial Limits) Order (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: This Order increases the jurisdiction of district judges in the county courts in Northern Ireland—

entry.title: The Isles of Scilly (Primary Care) Order 2001

ukm:Subject.Value: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This Order extends the provisions of the National Health Service (Primary Care) Act 1997 to the Isles of Scilly as from 2nd March 2001.
